contents:
(13) Also, another incorrect term used for rip currents is the "rip tide". (14) Rip currents would exist with or without tides. (15) However, low tide can enhance the intensity of the current.
(16) Rip currents can be killers as they are the leading surf hazard for all beachgoers. (17) They are particularly dangerous for weak or non-swimmers. (18) Rip current speeds are typically 1-2 feet per second. (19) However, speeds as high as 8 feet per second have been measured,  which is faster than an Olympic swimmer can sprint!
